20110106080200.000|20110106080202.000|TR0|COOPER:  We're going to get to politics a 
20110106080202.000|20110106080204.000|TR0|moment, but we begin actually with a 
20110106080204.000|20110106080206.000|TR0|breaking story tonight.
20110106080206.000|20110106080207.000|TR0|
20110106080207.000|20110106080209.000|TR0|Evidence of fraud against an autism 
20110106080209.000|20110106080211.000|TR0|researcher.  This is a big deal.  His name 
20110106080211.000|20110106080212.000|TR0|is Andrew Wakefield.  He's no longer a 
20110106080212.000|20110106080214.000|TR0|practicing doctor.  His medical license 
20110106080214.000|20110106080216.000|TR0|was stripped in Britain back in May.
20110106080216.000|20110106080217.000|TR0|
20110106080217.000|20110106080219.000|TR0|In a 1998 study published in the medical 
20110106080219.000|20110106080221.000|TR0|journal "The Lancet' he claimed to have 
20110106080221.000|20110106080223.000|TR0|found a link between vaccines that kids 
20110106080223.000|20110106080224.000|TR0|take and autism.  Now in the years since, 
20110106080224.000|20110106080226.000|TR0|as autism cases have inexplicably risen, 
20110106080226.000|20110106080228.000|TR0|an increasing number of parents have 
20110106080228.000|20110106080229.000|TR0|stopped getting their kids vaccinated.
20110106080229.000|20110106080231.000|TR0|
20110106080231.000|20110106080233.000|TR0|The Wakefield study has since been 
20110106080233.000|20110106080234.000|TR0|discredited and just tonight, an 
20110106080234.000|20110106080236.000|TR0|investigative journalist published his 
20110106080236.000|20110106080238.000|TR0|findings in the "British Medical Journal," 
20110106080238.000|20110106080240.000|TR0|"BMJ" calling the Wakefield study, quote, 
20110106080240.000|20110106080241.000|TR0|"an elaborate fraud."  A fraud that has 
20110106080241.000|20110106080243.000|TR0|done long-lasting damage to kid's health.
20110106080243.000|20110106080245.000|TR0|
20110106080245.000|20110106080246.000|TR0|Now, BMJ, this journal, says that 
20110106080246.000|20110106080248.000|TR0|Wakefield faked the data on the 12 kids 
20110106080248.000|20110106080250.000|TR0|who were the focus of the 1998 study.  Not 
20110106080250.000|20110106080251.000|TR0|just made a mistake.  They show evidence 
20110106080251.000|20110106080253.000|TR0|that he faked it and that he had financial 
20110106080253.000|20110106080255.000|TR0|motives for doing so.
20110106080255.000|20110106080257.000|TR0|
